result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:10 PM Defendant LOUIS J. CHEVALIER in court.  Attorney Joseph J. Kaupie in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brian T. Kane in court for LOUIS J. CHEVALIER. 
Dep. C. Vigue sworn & testifies.   Witness ID's DE. Cross-exam. Objection - relevance. Discussion held.  Court sustains. Closing arguments. 
Court finds PL has met the burden of proof, finds probable cause and binds the matter over for trial   ADA Kaupie - requests 30 days to file information.

BOND MODIFICATION:
Atty Kane - DE in process of being hired by Utility Co. that works out of State.  Requests the condition: "No travel outside the State" be removed.  ADA Kaupie - requests verification form employer when DE will be traveling outside the State and DE sign a waiver of extradition. Court will take up the issue if/when it arises. 
Arraignment scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
